item.title: Help with a command
item.dc:creator: @i_nelson_i i nelson i
item.description:
@i_nelson_i wrote:

you can try configure this to your base

if (playerCommand.startsWith("addxp")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int SkillID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int SkillAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if ((SkillID <= 24) && (SkillID >= 0)) { c.getPA().addSkillXP(SkillAmount, SkillID); c.getPA().refreshSkill(SkillID); } else { c.sendMessage("No such skill."); } } else { c.sendMessage("Use as ::addxp 0 200000"); } }

dont moan about conventions.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a command
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Here, I’ll rewrite it for you using String.split().

package com.rs.worldserver.model.player.command;

import com.rs.worldserver.model.player.Command;
import com.rs.worldserver.model.player.Client;
import com.rs.worldserver.Server;

/**
 * Adding experience
 *
 *
 *@author Scully
 */

public class AddXp implements Command {

	@Override
	public void execute(Client client, String cmd) {
		String[] parts = command.split(" ");
		if(parts.length != 3) {
			client.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("Usage: ::addxp level amt");
			return;
		}
		try {
			int playerLevel = Integer.parseInt(parts[1]);
			int playerXp = Integer.parseInt(parts[2]);
			client.getActionAssistant().addSkillXP(playerLevel, playerXp);
			client.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("Your experience has been changed as you asked.");
													
		} catch (NumberFormatException e) {
			if (Server.isDebugModeEnabled()) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
			client.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("Usage: ::addxp level amt");
		}
	}

}

Read full topic

int playerLevel = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6,8));
int playerXp = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(9));

				client.getActionAssistant().addSkillXP(playerLevel, playerXp);[/code]

item.title: Help with a command
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

Okay so I’m making an ::addxp command for my server, and I got it to compile. The sad part is it doesn’t add xp it just send me the message that it is the invalid syntax every time i try it.

Here is my code:

[code]package com.rs.worldserver.model.player.command;

import com.rs.worldserver.model.player.Command;
import com.rs.worldserver.model.player.Client;
import com.rs.worldserver.Server;

/**

  • Adding experience

*@author Scully
*/
public class AddXp implements Command {

@Override
public void execute(Client client, String command) {
	if (client.playerRights >= 0) {
		String[] parts = command.split(" ");
		try { 
				int playerLevel = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(6,8));
				int playerXp = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(9));

				client.getActionAssistant().addSkillXP(playerLevel, playerXp);

				client.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("Your experience has been changed as you asked.");
												
		} catch (Exception e) {
			if (Server.isDebugModeEnabled()) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
			client.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("Syntax is ::addxp <id> <amount>.");
		}
	}else{
		client.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("You do not have the correct rights to use ::addxp.");
		}
	}

}

[/code]

Any ideas as to what the problem is?

Read full topic
